moves.3... c5: That's a bit of a nuisance.  Happens quite often with this opening.  Better create a retreat square for my white squared Bishop.
moves.4. c3 Nc6 5. Nd2: Normal Stonewall developing move in preparation for f4 and Knights on e5 and f3.
moves.5... e5: Pete is coming full frontal..well I can't allow him to pushe4 so I must swap on e5.
moves.6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Be2: I want to keep my Bishop pair for the endgame so it's a bit of a toss up to stick the Bishop on c2 or e2.  I think its more useful on e2 as a Kingside attack seems a bit futile with both his knights on that side of the board and my Bishop can support a Queenside pawn advance from e2.
moves.7... Bd6 8. Ngf3: Natural developing on both sides..Black is getting a few pieces concentrating down on my Kingside..I will have to be careful.
moves.8... O-O 9. O-O: Both completing natural development and retreating Kings to a relatively safe position.
moves.9... Qe7 10. Re1: Putting my rook on same file as Blacks Queen to try to make him feel a wee bit more uncomfortable.  A sort of precurser for any tactical possibilities that may arise on that file and overprotecting e3.
moves.10... Rd8: He seems to have the same idea!..My Queen's out of there!
moves.11. Qc2: Survival instinct..my Queen is coming straight off the d file as soon as the Black Rook hits the file.
moves.11... g6: I don't know why black has played that..it seems to weaken the black squares around his King.
moves.12. Nxe5: Swap off his advanced knight then I can develop mu other knight to f3 giving my black squared Bishop a bit of air.
moves.12... Qxe5 13. Nf3 Qe7 14. h3: Don't want his pieces invading on g4.
moves.14... Bf5 15. Qd1:
Better move my Queen!...can't see much point in trading white-squared Bishops.

In hindsight maybe I should have played Bd3.
moves.15... Ne4: blacks pieces seem to be pouring into my space...I cant play Qxd5 because Bh2+ would slice her head off!
moves.16. Nh2: Fatal loading error!!!..didn't see Nxf2 overstretching my Monarch!
moves.18... Qe5+: Ouch again!..and again no choice! Kg1
moves.19. Kg1 Nxh3+: Crap...I am absolutely falling apart at the seems now!...if I play gxh6 I get mated in short order!  There are no good moves for white to play!
moves.21. Kg1 Ne4 22. Qd1: My pieces are trussed up like a Christmas turkey!...Back we go to d1 yet again...I might as well get a season ticket!
moves.22... Rd6 23. Bf3: gasping for air!...getting vsry desperate now!
moves.23... Qg3 24. Qe2: Yet another shuffle of Her Majesty!...I need to get my Black squared Bishop and Queens Rook into play but I fear I am fer too late to salvage anything.
moves.24... g5: g5...Here come Black's foot-soldiers for good measure!
moves.26... Rh6: Tell my wife I love her.
moves.27. Qf2 Rh1+:
AAAAARRRRGGGGHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!
Well played Pete!  Far too good for me.
